title: How to Make a Cappuccino with a French Press

steps.headline: Measure the amount of milk needed by filling the mug halfway with milk.
Pour this milk into a small pot and heat.
steps.description: It is not necessary to boil the milk. Skip this step if a cold cappuccino is desired.

steps.headline: Make espresso using either the French press or stove-top kettle.
steps.description: Espresso is richer in taste than coffee made in a coffee maker. Make what you prefer.

steps.headline: Pour espresso/coffee into the mug making sure not to exceed the halfway point.
steps.description: The stronger the coffee, the less you'll need.

steps.headline: Pour the milk into the French press.
Cover with the top/filter and pump up and down.
steps.description: The froth is created by pumping down into the milk and pumping up out of the milk while holding the top down.

steps.headline: Continue pumping until desired froth is reached.
Pour frothy milk over the espresso/coffee.
Sprinkle cocoa powder / chocolate shavings / cinnamon and/or ground nutmeg.
